protocol_name: Large Volume Marine Cyanophage Phage Purification
protocol_name_html: Large Volume Marine Cyanophage Phage Purification
description: Last optimized January 2006, updated by Matt on March 16 2009
guidelines:
This protocol comes from a group of other protocols.This protocol is (1) of (4):
1. 'Large Volume Marine Cyanophage Phage Protocols'
2. 'DNA Extraction Protocol'
3. 'DNA Precipitation Protocol'
4. 'Checking DNA Concentration with Agarose Gel'

Needed:
  • 2L Pro99
  • Cyanophage stock
  • SYBR titering
  • 10 mL chloroform / L phage lysate
  • Incubator
  • Centrifuge Beckman Ja-14 @ 12,500 rpm
  • Kim Wipes
  • Polyethylene Glycol (PEG)
  • Orbital shaker @ 150 rpm
  • CsCl step gradient (1.3, 1.4, 1.5, 1.65 bands)
  • Ultracentrifuge tubes
  • Concentrated phage samples
  • SW28 swinging bucket rotor @ 28,000 rpm
  • Slide-A-Lyzer dialysis cassettes
  • 3M and 1.8M NaCo
  • NaCl buffer
  • Tris HCl
  • MgCl2

RNase 100ng/ul = 100ug/ml ==> 1:10 = 10ug/ml ==> use 1 ml/L or use UD at 100 ul/L

components.data: Grow up cells in large volumes (1-2L) to yield ~10<sup>11</sup> - 10<sup>12</sup> cells using 'microbubbling' technique.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grow up cells in large volumes (1-2L) to yield ~10<sup>11</sup> - 10<sup>12</sup> cells using 'microbubbling' technique.

components.data: Grow up cells
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Grow up cells

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Large Volume Marine Cyanophage Phage Protocols
source_data.protocol_name: Large Volume Marine Cyanophage Phage Purification
source_data.protocol_name_html: Large Volume Marine Cyanophage Phage Purification
source_data.annotation: Use ‘microbubbling’ technique: acid-washed glass bubblers, along with an air source that has been pre-bubbled through water and pre-filtered before entering the culture
source_data.thread_text: Use ‘microbubbling’ technique: acid-washed glass bubblers, along with an air source that has been pre-bubbled through water and pre-filtered before entering the culture
source_data.body: Use ‘microbubbling’ technique: acid-washed glass bubblers, along with an air source that has been pre-bubbled through water and pre-filtered before entering the culture

source_data.description: For use in the protocol "Large Volume Marine Cyanophage protocols"

components.data: Inoculate 2L Pro99 with exponentially growing cells (~20-50 ml of dense cells, ~10<sup>8</sup> cells ml<sup>-1</sup>)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Inoculate 2L Pro99 with exponentially growing cells (~20-50 ml of dense cells, ~10<sup>8</sup> cells ml<sup>-1</sup>)

components.data: Let cells grow to about mid 10<sup>7</sup> cells ml<sup>-1</sup>
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let cells grow to about mid 10<sup>7</sup> cells ml<sup>-1</sup>

components.data: Add as much cyanophage stock as available (up to an infective MOI = 3)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add as much cyanophage stock as available (up to an infective MOI = 3)

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Microbubbling technique
source_data.annotation: NOTE: Average cyanophage lysates are ~10^8 - 10^9 SYBR ml^-1; only ~0.1-10% of that is usually infective (as assayed with MPNs)
source_data.thread_text: NOTE: Average cyanophage lysates are ~10^8 - 10^9 SYBR ml^-1; only ~0.1-10% of that is usually infective (as assayed with MPNs)
source_data.body: NOTE: Average cyanophage lysates are ~10^8 - 10^9 SYBR ml^-1; only ~0.1-10% of that is usually infective (as assayed with MPNs)

components.data: Adsorb for about 60 minutes without bubbling
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Adsorb for about 60 minutes without bubbling

components.data: Start bubbling again
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Start bubbling again

components.data: Add 1xPro99 amounts of N, P every ~3 days until see 'lysis' (by eye, or more rigorously by a decrease in cell concentration)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1xPro99 amounts of N, P every ~3 days until see 'lysis' (by eye, or more rigorously by a decrease in cell concentration)

components.data: Confirm phage production by SYBR titering
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Confirm phage production by SYBR titering

components.data: Add Rnase A (10ug ml-1 = for 2L, 250µl of Qiagen's 100mg/ml stock) and DNase1 (0.25 SU ml-1 =2L, add 50µl of stock).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add Rnase A (10ug ml-1 = for 2L, 250µl of Qiagen's 100mg/ml stock) and DNase1 (0.25 SU ml-1 =2L, add 50µl of stock).

components.data: Step dialyze in Slide-A-Lyzer dialysis cassettes (Pierce #66425; 10K MWCO, 0.5-3.0 ml volume) - 30 minutes against 5xNaCl (3M), 3xNaCl (1.8M), two changes of 1xNaCl buffer [MTM100 = 600 mM NaCl, 100 mM TrisHCL (pH = 7.5), 100 mM MgCl<sub>2</sub>]
components.name: Description
